author: Peerzada Ashiq
text:
Mainstream and separatist leaders unequivocally condemned the Pakistan varsity attack and described it as “an act of terrorism.”

Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) president Mehbooba Mufti described the attack as “a cowardly act of brutality.”

“I share their pain and offer my deepest condolences. We stand united with the people and the Government of Pakistan in their resolve to fight the menace of terrorism and condemn use of violence under any circumstances. Today’s [Wednesday’s] attack in Pakistan and the recent attack on an airbase in Pathankot are a grim reminder of how the terrorists are trying to destabilise the region,” said Ms. Mufti. Hurriyat faction chairman Mirwaiz Umar Farooq said: “Terrorism in any form and at any place is condemnable.”

‘No place for terror’

Stating that “there is no place for terror in Islam,” he said the “international community needs to take [a] united stand against terrorism and make combined efforts to curb this menace.”

JKLF chairperson Muhammad Yasin Malik termed the attack on students as “barbaric.”

“Attacking educational institutions is inhuman and uncivilised. [The] first word of the first revelation to our beloved Prophet Muhammad was ‘Read’ and those who attack schools, colleges, universities and other institutions related to education are actually acting against Koran and trying to push our next generations towards darkness.”
title: A cowardly act, says Mehbooba
